text: If $A = \{1, 2\}$ and $B = \{a, b\}$, then $A \times B$ is:
If $A = \{1, 2, 3\}$ and $B = \{3, 4, 5\}$, find $A \cup B$ and $A \cap B$.
answer:
Solution:
$A \cup B$ (Union) is the set of all elements in either A or B.
$A \cup B = \{1, 2, 3, 4, 5\}$.
$A \cap B$ (Intersection) is the set of elements common to both A and B.
$A \cap B = \{3\}$.
